S.FORM: amu ka taic'an na kitnga' ata.
amo ka taic'an na kitnga' ata.
amun ka taisic'an mahaip pa' na masnava' a sinsi' i pailcicia ki kakaunun tu qalinga.
amon ka taisic'an mahaip pa' na masnava' a sinsi' i pailcicia ki kakaonon to qalinga.
S.TRANSL: 大家好。今天老師要教大家食物的布農語怎麼說。
Hello everyone. Today, I am going to teach you how to say the Bunun language for food.
Do you understand what the teacher says?

S.FORM: sinsi', ni' cak itqal. maqtu' asu muqnang tupa?
sinsi', ni' cak itqal. maqto' aso moqnang topa?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我不懂。可以再說一次嗎?
I don’t understand. Can you repeat it again?

S.FORM: ni cak tan'a, pidaining ka qalinga.
ni cak tan'a, pidaining ka qalinga.
S.TRANSL: 我聽不到，可以大聲一點嗎?
I can’t hear you, can you speak louder?

S.FORM: sadu'a di, sisili zaku muc'an masipul.
sado'a di, sisili zako moc'an masipol.
S.TRANSL: 請看這裡! 跟著我唸一遍。
Look here, please! Repeat after me.
Read it again. Please speak louder.
I forgot to bring my pen.

S.FORM: sinsi', panpungul cak madas si isqaqaisqais.
sinsi', panpongol cak madas si isqaqaisqais.
S.TRANSL: I forgot to bring my eraser.

S.FORM: dian simul isqaqaisqais ha'an qaviaz su'.
dian simol isqaqaisqais ha'an qaviaz so'.
S.TRANSL: 請跟旁邊同學借橡皮擦。
Please borrow erasers from your classmates.

S.FORM: pan'iti' ata haip, na muqnang niciuvi' pasadu.
pan'iti' ata haip, na moqnang niciovi' pasado.
S.TRANSL: 我們就上到這邊，下週再見。
Class dismissed, see you next week.

S.FORM: icia cak Atul uvaz'az, tupa'un cak tu Kavida'.
icia cak Atol ovaz'az, topa'on cak to Kavida'.
S.TRANSL: I am the son of Atul, and my name is Kavida’.

S.FORM: icia cak Umin pantu', Sai nak ka ngan.
icia cak Umin panto', Sai nak ka ngan.
S.TRANSL: I am a student in Umin, my name is Sai.

S.FORM: tukau'un cia tama su a ngan?
tokao'on cia tama so a ngan?
tupa'un nak ka tama tu Atul.
topa'on nak ka tama to Atol.
masituqas nak aipa', tupa'un tu Kavida'.
masitoqas nak aipa', topa'on to Kavida'.
S.TRANSL: He is my brother, his name is Kavida’.

S.FORM: tupa'un ciata' a ngan tu Kavida'.
topa'on ciata' a ngan to Kavida'.
Puni naipa'. masinauba' i tina nak.
Poni naipa'. masinaoba' i tina nak.
kaviaz nak naipa', tupa'un tu Sani.
kaviaz nak naipa', topa'on to Sani.
S.TRANSL: 她是我的朋友，她的名字是Sani。
She is my friend and her name is Sani.

S.FORM: pin cia tama su a qamisan?
pin cia tama so a qamisan?
mahima'un cia tama nak ka qamisan.
mahima'on cia tama nak ka qamisan.
papia su a masituqas cin masinoba'?
papia so a masitoqas cin masinoba'?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?

S.FORM: dusa' nak ka masituqas cin tatini ka masinauba'.
dosa' nak ka masitoqas cin tatini ka masinaoba'.
S.TRANSL: 我有兩個兄姐，一個弟妹。
I have two brothers and sisters and one younger brother and sister.
How many people are in your family?
There are four of us in our family.
你的舅舅從事什麼工作?
What does your uncle do for a living?
Does your sister have a job?
他們兩個人是兄弟姐妹嗎?
Yes, but she is a Amis.
Yes, we are all very tall.
Does your sister go to school?
Do your siblings speak the language?
Yes, they speak the ethnic language.

S.FORM: papia su a masituqas cin masinoba'?
papia so a masitoqas cin masinoba'?
S.TRANSL: How many brothers and sisters do you have?
I have three brothers and sisters.
你和爸爸媽媽一起住嗎?
Do you live with your parents?
是，我和爸爸媽媽一起住。
Yes, I live with my mom and dad.
你和爺爺奶奶一起住嗎?
Do you live with your grandparents?
不，我沒和跟他們一起住。
No, I didn’t live with them.

S.FORM: muskun cak tamatina nak cin masitoqas nak.
moskon cak tamatina nak cin masitoqas nak.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥住在一起。
I live with my father, mother and brother.
你什麼時候會回去部落?
When are you going back to the tribe?

S.FORM: tudip pi pal'u'unin na mucuqis munacang.
todip pi pal'o'onin na mocoqis monacang.
S.TRANSL: I will go back in the summer.
The sun is coming out, it's very hot.
Is it going to be cold outside?
It's cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: mahaip pa ni tu makazhav ni amin maklang, macihal.
mahaip pa ni to makazhav ni amin maklang, macihal.
S.TRANSL: 今天不冷也不熱，很舒服。
It's neither cold nor hot today, very comfortable.

S.FORM: uka' haip luhum, minsuma'in na bintuqan.
oka' haip lohom, minsoma'in na bintoqan.
S.TRANSL: 今天沒有雲，星星出來了。
There are no clouds today, the stars are out.

S.FORM: laupang isdangza, minsuma'in na vali, minsuma'in amin na qainivalval.
laopang isdangza, minsoma'in na vali, minsoma'in amin na qainivalval.
S.TRANSL: 雨剛剛停，出了太陽，彩虹出來了。
The rain has just stopped, the sun has come out, the rainbow is coming out.
What's the weather like where you are?
We're going to have a big storm here.
Very well, out of the big sun.
I have to go to school.

S.FORM: makazhav va diqanin, pidai'un na huluc mainuk.
makazhav va diqanin, pidai'on na holoc mainok.
S.TRANSL: The weather is very cold, so wear more clothes.

S.FORM: sudaq qai unisin na, ka'a tu panpungulan na talulung.
sodaq qai onisin na, ka'a to panpongolan na talolong.
S.TRANSL: 等一下會下大雨，你要記得帶傘。
It's going to rain heavily, you have to remember to bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: bitvaqan sangan na' qudanan qai unisin na.
bitvaqan sangan na' qodanan qai onisin na.
S.TRANSL: 剛剛打雷了，等一下應該就會下雨。
There was thunder just now, and it's supposed to rain later.
剛剛有下雨，現在雨停了。
It just rained, and now it's stopped.

S.FORM: maupat qenudanan sangan pang, luvuc ca dan ni'.
maopat qenodanan sangan pang, lovoc ca dan ni'.
S.TRANSL: 好像下過雨了，馬路是濕的。
It seems to have rained and the road is wet.

S.FORM: qudanan pang? tuc asu luvuc ci'.
qodanan pang? toc aso lovoc ci'.
S.TRANSL: 有下雨嗎?你怎麼全身都濕了?
Is it raining? Why are you all wet?

S.FORM: qudanan na nata' a, ni cak madas si talulung.
qodanan na nata' a, ni cak madas si talolong.
S.TRANSL: 外面在下雨，我沒有帶雨傘。
It's raining outside, so I didn't bring an umbrella.

S.FORM: madaing nga luvluv va', macaqbit nak ka bungu.
madaing nga lovlov va', macaqbit nak ka bongo.
S.TRANSL: The wind is blowing so hard that my head hurts.

S.FORM: madaing nga vali ka', qailipacav nak ka bungu.
madaing nga vali ka', qailipacav nak ka bongo.
S.TRANSL: 太陽好大，曬得我頭好暈。
The sun is so big, it makes me dizzy.
I forgot to bring my pen.
I forgot to bring my chopsticks.

S.FORM: uka' amin nak, ina' mabaliv ata.
oka' amin nak, ina' mabaliv ata.
S.TRANSL: 我也沒有帶，走我們去買。
I don’t have it either. Let’s go buy it.

S.FORM: ina' dan ata baliv vi ispapatas u?
ina' dan ata baliv vi ispapatas o?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go buy a pen, shall we?

S.FORM: u, na mabalivanq cak ki isqaqaisqais.
o, na mabalivanq cak ki isqaqaisqais.
S.TRANSL: Well, I still have to buy erasers.

S.FORM: ina' mabaliv ata kaunun tingmut, u?
ina' mabaliv ata kaonon tingmot, o?
S.TRANSL: Let’s go get breakfast, shall we?
No, I’ve already eaten at home.
I forgot to steam my lunchbox.
I forgot to bring my lunchbox.
那我們一起吃我的便當吧!
Then let’s eat my lunch box together!
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: ma'un cak itu kaku' tu paitutungquvali'.
ma'on cak ito kako' to paitotongqovali'.
S.TRANSL: 我要吃學校的營養午餐。
I want a nutritious school lunch.
What are you having for lunch?

S.FORM: madas cak ki timoqus haip, ma'aqi tungquvali' ka' muskun ata ma'un.
madas cak ki timoqos haip, ma'aqi tongqovali' ka' moskon ata ma'on.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有帶便當，我們中午一起吃吧!
I’ve brought a lunchbox today, let’s eat together at noon!
Let’s go play basketball, shall we?
Please help me with the broom.
Okay, here’s a broomstick for you.

S.FORM: kadangazin cak siza' i iukin, u?
kadangazin cak siza' i iokin, o?
S.TRANSL: Can you help me with the cloth?

S.FORM: ma'asikang cak, tupa'i ka Atul tu kadangazin asu siza'.
ma'asikang cak, topa'i ka Atol to kadangazin aso siza'.
S.TRANSL: I’m sweeping the floor and you asked Atul to carry it for you.
The floor is dirty, go clean it.
Okay, I’ll go get the cloth.
那個窗戶很髒，去擦一下。
That window is very dirty, go clean it.

S.FORM: mal'u'ang, ni'ang cak kanaqtung ma'asik iti.
mal'o'ang, ni'ang cak kanaqtong ma'asik iti.
S.TRANSL: 等一下，我還沒掃完這裡。
Wait a minute, I’m not done sweeping here yet.
I’m going to see my teacher.

S.FORM: malkama'aq qa asu maca pal'u'un unisin?
malkama'aq qa aso maca pal'o'on onisin?
S.TRANSL: What do you do after school?

S.FORM: na muskun cak kaviaz nak tusauc.
na moskon cak kaviaz nak tosaoc.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to sing with my friends.

S.FORM: malkama'aq qa naip maca pal'u'unin unisin?
malkama'aq qa naip maca pal'o'onin onisin?

S.TRANSL: She’s at home, please come in.

S.FORM: uka' naip lumaq, haiza' su singkukuza'?
oka' naip lomaq, haiza' so singkokoza'?
S.TRANSL: 她不在，請問你有什麼事?
She’s not here, what can I do for you?

S.FORM: qudas, zaku Sai, tau'i ka hilav vi.
qodas, zako Sai, tao'i ka hilav vi.
S.TRANSL: Grandpa, I’m Sai, please open the door.

S.FORM: Kavida', Atul cak, kilim cak su'u paqaqainan.
Kavida', Atol cak, kilim cak so'o paqaqainan.
S.TRANSL: Kavida’, I’m Atul, I’ve come to play with you.
Yes! What are you busy with!
Please sit down and have some tea.

S.FORM: ai macial mu saviq qudan ni.
ai macial mo saviq qodan ni.
tunganin na tina pi'ia paitusanavan, maunin!
tonganin na tina pi'ia paitosanavan, maonin!
S.TRANSL: 媽媽煮好晚餐了，快來吃吧!
Mom has cooked dinner, come and eat!
Okay, I’ll go wash my hands.

S.FORM: ka'a tu maz'av, bunun qa ata tu'.
ka'a to maz'av, bonon qa ata to'.
S.TRANSL: 盡量吃喝，你又不是外人。
Try to eat and drink as much as possible, you’re not an outsider.
I ate a lot, I’m full.

S.FORM: na ngausin cak mudan, na muqnang cak muniti' sadu su'u.
na ngaosin cak modan, na moqnang cak moniti' sado so'o.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，下次再來看你。
I’m leaving, I’ll see you next time.
好的，慢走 歡迎再來。

S.FORM: maqmutin ni, na danin cak mulumaq.
maqmotin ni, na danin cak molomaq.

S.TRANSL: Okay, come to my house sometime.

S.FORM: dasun ku amu munacang kilim madadaingaz.
dason ko amo monacang kilim madadaingaz.
S.TRANSL: 今天我帶大家去部落訪問耆老。
Today I am taking you to the tribe to interview the elders.
好喔!我們要跟耆老說布農語。
Okay! We’re going to speak Bunun to the seniors.
Grandpa, we’ve come to see you.

S.FORM: ai maqanciap amu malasBunun! ai mailmananu'!
ai maqanciap amo malasBonon! ai mailmanano'!
S.TRANSL: 你們會說布農語啊!真是太棒了!

S.FORM: ina dasun ku amu munha'an quma malkamaduq.
ina dason ko amo monha'an qoma malkamadoq.
S.TRANSL: 走 今天要帶大家去小米田工作。
Let’s go. Today we are going to take you to work in the rice fields.

S.FORM: amin sopa di pidailaz, aun na iskukuza tu qaimangsut panpungulan madas.
amin sopa di pidailaz, aon na iskokoza to qaimangsot panpongolan madas.
S.TRANSL: 大家過來排隊，記得帶好工具。
Come and line up, remember to bring your tools.

S.FORM: u, sinsi', aminunin zami madas sa qaimangsut.
o, sinsi', aminonin zami madas sa qaimangsot.
S.TRANSL: 是的，老師，我們都拿好工具了。
Yes, sir, we’ve got our tools.
Not yet, it’s still far away.

S.FORM: su'ua ka siza' i paqpaq qa.
so'oa ka siza' i paqpaq qa.
S.TRANSL: You go get the bird catcher.
Okay, I’ll go and catch the birds.

S.FORM: ina', munha'an ata haip luluman ni tusmumut tu luluman.
ina', monha'an ata haip loloman ni tosmomot to loloman.
S.TRANSL: We are going to the zoo today.
好棒喔!我們要怎麼去呢?
Awesome! How are we going to get there?

S.FORM: dian tidailaz, na mabaliv ata kipu'.
dian tidailaz, na mabaliv ata kipo'.
S.TRANSL: 大家排好隊，我們準備買票。
Everyone line up, we are ready to buy tickets.

S.FORM: ma'aq qa tantangaus sa amin qai lauqi, ma'aq qa tankinuz za amin qai ivut, amin ata anakanak sadu.
ma'aq qa tantangaos sa amin qai laoqi, ma'aq qa tankinoz za amin qai ivot, amin ata anakanak sado.
S.TRANSL: 前面是鳥類，後面是蛇類，大家自己參觀。
There are birds in the front and snakes in the back.

S.FORM: ni tu makua, ipin asu sadu lauqi'.
ni to makoa, ipin aso sado laoqi'.
S.TRANSL: It doesn’t matter, then you go and watch the birds.

S.FORM: maqi tasbanin tas'a zikang, asa tu mucuqis muniti mu'ampuk.
maqi tasbanin tas'a zikang, asa to mocoqis moniti mo'ampok.
S.TRANSL: 我們一個小時後,回來集合。
We’ll meet back in an hour.

S.FORM: sadu cak madia ivut, haizang madia tu luqi'.
sado cak madia ivot, haizang madia to loqi'.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了好多蛇，還有好多鳥。
I saw a lot of snakes and a lot of birds.
Hurry up, we have to go.

S.FORM: atala'in cak, mamuqu' nak ka bantac.
atala'in cak, mamoqo' nak ka bantac.
S.TRANSL: Wait for me, my feet are tired.
There are a lot of people swimming here.

S.FORM: makumbu' ita a danum, malau ata iti lingqaul ina.
makombo' ita a danom, malao ata iti lingqaol ina.
S.TRANSL: 那裡水很深，我們在這裡游泳就好。
The water is deep there, so we just swim here.
What kind of car did you take?
How do you go to church?
How does he usually go to school?
He took the subway to school.

S.FORM: mukuaq qa qudas su munata' mabaliv vi sanglav?
mokoaq qa qodas so monata' mabaliv vi sanglav?
S.TRANSL: How does your grandmother go to the grocery store?
She went to the grocery store on a motorcycle.
How are you going to get to Orchid Island?
I want to take a boat to Lanyu.
How did he get to Orchid Island?
He took a plane to Orchid Island.
What bus did he take to Kaohsiung?
He took the THSR to Kaohsiung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?
Yes, he took a train to Taitung.
Did he take a train to Taitung?

S.FORM: ni, tunha'an naip hikuki munha'an Taitu'.
ni, tonha'an naip hikoki monha'an Taito'.
S.TRANSL: No, he took a plane to Taitung.
Is there a bus stop near here?

S.FORM: haiza', sopa tatangaustun na sadu asu tudaza'an basu qai.
haiza', sopa tatangaoston na sado aso todaza'an baso qai.
S.TRANSL: 有，往前走就會看到公車站了。
Yes, if you go straight ahead, you will see the bus stop.
離這裡最近的捷運站在哪裡?
Where is the nearest MRT station?

S.FORM: uka' iti tudaza'an ce'iun, asa asu tu tunha'an kitingcia.
oka' iti todaza'an ce'ion, asa aso to tonha'an kitingcia.
S.TRANSL: 這裡沒有捷運站，你只能坐計程車。
There is no MRT station here, you can only take a taxi.

S.FORM: maqi tunha'an basu' a' talpiaq qa kaha'an kaku'.
maqi tonha'an baso' a' talpiaq qa kaha'an kako'.
S.TRANSL: How long does it take to get to the school by bus?

S.FORM: mac'an qan hima' huncong kaha'an kaku'.
mac'an qan hima' honcong kaha'an kako'.
maqi tunha'an kaute talpiaq qa zikang kaha'an Taiciu?
maqi tonha'an kaote talpiaq qa zikang kaha'an Taicio?
S.TRANSL: 搭高鐵要多久時間會到臺中?
How long does it take to get to Taichung by THSR?

S.FORM: na haiza' tu tastuzikang kaha'an Taiciu.
na haiza' to tastozikang kaha'an Taicio.
S.TRANSL: I will come to Taichung in an hour.

S.FORM: maqi ma'unting lehleh munha'an Ulai a' talmadia?
maqi ma'onting lehleh monha'an Ulai a' talmadia?
S.TRANSL: Is it a long drive to Ulai?

S.FORM: maqi tunha'an asu ce'iun sopa lumaq nak ka'? piaq qa zikang.
maqi tonha'an aso ce'ion sopa lomaq nak ka'? piaq qa zikang.
S.TRANSL: 你搭捷運來我家要多久?
How long did it take you to come to my house by subway?
Do you know how to ride a bicycle?

S.FORM: ni, opa ni nak madia a qancaipan.
ni, opa ni nak madia a qancaipan.
S.TRANSL: Don’t, I don’t know much about it.

S.FORM: lumaq asu maca tinaungquvali' haip? asa cak tantungu su'uan maqtu?
lomaq aso maca tinaongqovali' haip? asa cak tantongo so'oan maqto?
S.TRANSL: 你下午有空嗎?我想去拜訪你可以嗎?
Are you free this afternoon? I’d like to visit you, is that okay?

S.FORM: u na malau, na ha'an cak lumaq matala' su'u.
o na malao, na ha'an cak lomaq matala' so'o.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I’ll wait for you at home.

S.FORM: haza su al'u'an laqbing? asa cak macingav pailcicia itu Bunun tu takiqabasan.
haza so al'o'an laqbing? asa cak macingav pailcicia ito Bonon to takiqabasan.
S.TRANSL: 你明天有空嗎?我想請問你關於布農族的傳說故事。
Are you free tomorrow? I’d like to ask you about the legendary story of the [Bunun] people.

S.FORM: uka' cak laqbing, na munba'av cak.
oka' cak laqbing, na monba'av cak.
S.TRANSL: 明天我不在，我要去山上。
Tomorrow I’m not here, I’m going to the mountains.

S.FORM: tan'a cak tu su'u dau ka malmananu maqanciap itu Bunun tu iniqumican. asa cak pascingav su'u.
tan'a cak to so'o dao ka malmanano maqanciap ito Bonon to iniqomican. asa cak pascingav so'o.
S.TRANSL: 我聽說您對Bunun族的傳統習俗非常了解，想要請教您一下。
I heard that you are very familiar with the traditional customs of the Bunun, so I would like to ask you a few questions.

S.FORM: ni amin nak madia a qancaipun, na langatlangat antalam su'u ina.
ni amin nak madia a qancaipon, na langatlangat antalam so'o ina.
S.TRANSL: 我所了解的不多，但是我會盡量回答。
I don’t know much about it, but I will try to answer as best I can.

S.FORM: maqtu cak siza' i qaningu? na ni tu panpungulan.
maqto cak siza' i qaningo? na ni to panpongolan.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以錄影嗎?才不會忘記。
May I record? I won’t forget.

S.FORM: masiva'un qan vau'in nak qa qamisan.
masiva'on qan vao'in nak qa qamisan.

S.TRANSL: I am from Damar Luan (Deli Village).
請問您的太太也是布農族人嗎?
我會說布農語和泰雅語。
I can speak Bunun and Atayal.

S.FORM: manaskal maqtu asu latuza' pacingavan, macingav su'u paicicia qanup tu samu?
manaskal maqto aso latoza' pacingavan, macingav so'o paicicia qanop to samo?
S.TRANSL: 今天很高興能訪問您，請您談一下，有關狩獵的禁忌好嗎?
It’s a pleasure to interview you today, can you talk about the taboo of hunting?

S.FORM: na malau, qanglac cak munba'av qanup tu vakai'ang qabas.
na malao, qanglac cak monba'av qanop to vakai'ang qabas.
S.TRANSL: 好的。我年輕的時候很常上山打獵。
Yes. I used to go hunting in the mountains when I was young.

S.FORM: miqumicang, mailmananu' su haip pa sintaqu'.
miqomicang, mailmanano' so haip pa sintaqo'.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝，您今天所教導的真是太棒了。
Thank you, what you taught me today was really great.

S.FORM: mamantuk nak ka sinbazbaz, itu madadaingaz tu sintataqu.
mamantok nak ka sinbazbaz, ito madadaingaz to sintataqo.
S.TRANSL: 我所説的都是千真萬確的，祖先所流傳的講述。
All that I say is true, the sayings of my ancestors.

S.FORM: maqtu'in pan'iti haip pa ispabazbaz, tuza' tu miqumicang sala su'u.
maqto'in pan'iti haip pa ispabazbaz, toza' to miqomicang sala so'o.
S.TRANSL: 今天的訪談就到這邊。非常謝謝您的分享。
That’s all for today’s interview. Thank you very much for sharing with us.

S.FORM: ni tu makua, na muqnang patataqu maca lakuin dau.
ni to makoa, na moqnang patataqo maca lakoin dao.
na mungausin cak mudan, na lakuin ata muqnang tan'a su'u tataqu.
na mongaosin cak modan, na lakoin ata moqnang tan'a so'o tataqo.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開了，期待下次聽到更多的故事。
I’m going to leave now and look forward to hearing more stories next time.
I want to buy a cup.
Hello, what are you looking for?
I want to buy a hat.

S.FORM: na mabaliv cak kupu', haiza' mu?
na mabaliv cak kopo', haiza' mo?
S.TRANSL: 我要買杯子，你們有賣嗎?
I want to buy a cup, do you sell them?
Yes, how many do you want to buy?

S.FORM: uka', ni cam balilivan ni pinung.
oka', ni cam balilivan ni pinong.
S.TRANSL: No, we don't sell betel nut.
How many packs do you want to buy?
I want to buy sweet potatoes.
All the sweet potatoes are sold out.
I want to buy two bottles of oil.
We only have one bottle left.
How many pounds do you want to buy?

S.FORM: pai'un qa su tingting nga qapuan mabaliv?
pai'on qa so tingting nga qapoan mabaliv?
S.TRANSL: How many pounds of eggs do you want to buy?
I want to buy two catties.

S.FORM: mabaliv cak calu maqtu' dusa' linauquc.
mabaliv cak calo maqto' dosa' linaoqoc.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy two green onions.

S.FORM: haizang tau linauquc kitda'an, aminih paisu!
haizang tao linaoqoc kitda'an, aminih paiso!
S.TRANSL: There are three left, all for you!

S.FORM: piaq qa cui tas'a qalup tilac ci?
piaq qa coi tas'a qalop tilac ci?
S.TRANSL: How much is this bag of rice?

S.FORM: amin mapusan qan tas'a cui, lu'azi mapusan cui ina.
amin maposan qan tas'a coi, lo'azi maposan coi ina.
haizang masiva'un qan hima' cui di.
haizang masiva'on qan hima' coi di.

S.TRANSL: I'll buy some more, and make up 100 yuan.

S.FORM: muavin na di maqlic, maqtu huthutunang?
moavin na di maqlic, maqto hothotonang?
S.TRANSL: 這個太貴了，可以算便宜一點嗎?
It's too expensive, can you make it cheaper?
不行，這個已經很便宜了。
No, this is already very cheap.
I want this packet of cookies.

S.FORM: mati'un na pingkan di, haizang su duma' siza'un?
mati'on na pingkan di, haizang so doma' siza'on?
S.TRANSL: 這餅乾30元，還需要別的東西嗎?
$30 for the cookies, anything else you need?
Can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: na malau! pai'un qa su simul la cui?
na malao! pai'on qa so simol la coi?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How much do you need?

S.FORM: minpungul cak madas si cui, maqtu' asu pasimul zaku ki cui?
minpongol cak madas si coi, maqto' aso pasimol zako ki coi?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?
I don’t have any money either!

S.FORM: minpungul cak madas si cui, maqtu' asu pasimul zaku ki cui?
minpongol cak madas si coi, maqto' aso pasimol zako ki coi?
S.TRANSL: 我忘記帶錢了，我可以跟你借錢嗎?
I forgot to bring money, can I borrow money from you?

S.FORM: ni, opa ni'ang asu macauqis tangusang tu sinimulan na.
ni, opa ni'ang aso macaoqis tangosang to sinimolan na.
S.TRANSL: 不要，上次借的錢你都還沒還我。
No, you haven’t paid me back the money you borrowed last time.
請借給我你的腳踏車好嗎?
Can I borrow your bicycle, please?

S.FORM: u na malau, asa tu cuqaisun laqbing.
o na malao, asa to coqaison laqbing.
S.TRANSL: Okay, but you have to give it back to me tomorrow.

S.FORM: qudananin ni', minpungul cak madas talulung, pasimulin cak talulung su?
qodananin ni', minpongol cak madas talolong, pasimolin cak talolong so?
S.TRANSL: 下雨了，我沒有帶傘，借我傘好嗎?
It’s raining, I don’t have an umbrella, can you lend me your umbrella?

S.FORM: muaz nak tas'a ka talulung, muskun ata talulungan ina!
moaz nak tas'a ka talolong, moskon ata talolongan ina!
S.TRANSL: 我只有一把傘，我們一起撐吧!
I only have an umbrella, let’s stick together!

S.FORM: maqa hung di ka', sinpasimul su zaku tangusang nga', cuqaisun ku su'uan.
maqa hong di ka', sinpasimol so zako tangosang nga', coqaison ko so'oan.
S.TRANSL: 這是你上次借我的書，還給你。
This is the book you borrowed from me last time, I give it back to you.

S.FORM: maqi haizang asa'un su sadu ka', taqu'in cak.
maqi haizang asa'on so sado ka', taqo'in cak.
S.TRANSL: 還想看什麼書都可以跟我說。
You can tell me what else you want to read.

S.FORM: na laquaq cak macuqis si cui su i'?
na laqoaq cak macoqis si coi so i'?
S.TRANSL: When do I have to pay you back?

S.FORM: ni tu makua, tudip pi haizin su cui ka' na.
ni to makoa, todip pi haizin so coi ka' na.
S.TRANSL: 沒關係，你有錢的時候再說。
It doesn’t matter, you can talk about it when you have money.
When are you going to pay me back?
I’ll return it to you tomorrow.
When are you going to return my book?
我昨天不是已經還你了嗎?
Didn’t I return it to you yesterday?

S.FORM: cia Atul la pasimul su enpicu' di?
cia Atol la pasimol so enpico' di?
S.TRANSL: Did Atul lend you this pen?

S.FORM: u, ha'an cak ci'an ta simul, haip.
o, ha'an cak ci'an ta simol, haip.
S.TRANSL: Yes, I borrowed it from him today.

S.FORM: ma'aq qa enpicu' di ka' sinimul su ha'an Sai?
ma'aq qa enpico' di ka' sinimol so ha'an Sai?
S.TRANSL: Did you borrow this pen from Sai?
No, this is what mom bought.

S.FORM: uka'in na qacila, ina'in munha'an Sani ta simul li qacila.
oka'in na qacila, ina'in monha'an Sani ta simol li qacila.
S.TRANSL: We’re out of salt, let’s go borrow some from Sani.

S.FORM: tupa'i ka Puni tu cuqaisi ka cui nak.
topa'i ka Poni to coqaisi ka coi nak.
S.TRANSL: Go tell Puni to give me back my money.
How much does she owe you?
I’m going to plant vegetables in the garden.

S.FORM: muav madia' a ismut, unzaku maqun, na culan zaku danum unisin.
moav madia' a ismot, onzako maqon, na colan zako danom onisin.
S.TRANSL: 草太多了，我在砍草，等一下要澆水。
There’s too much grass, I’m cutting it, I’ll have to water it later.

S.FORM: kadangazin cak siza' i kaul cin tanga' u?
kadangazin cak siza' i kaol cin tanga' o?
S.TRANSL: 幫我把鐮刀和鋤頭拿來好嗎?
Will you get my scythes and hoes, please?
Put it next to the plow rake.
Did you turn over the soil?

S.FORM: laupang leqangvanan, na pinangan mac lakiun.
laopang leqangvanan, na pinangan mac lakion.
S.TRANSL: 我剛翻過土，等等要播種。
I just turned over the soil, and so on to sow seeds.

S.FORM: maqtu'in na sincuaz su sanglav kaunun?
maqto'in na sincoaz so sanglav kaonon?
S.TRANSL: 你種的菜可以收成了嗎?
Are your vegetables ready to be harvested?

S.FORM: maqtu'in na kanlang iti siza'un, ni'ang ita sanglav-samaq maqtu siza'un.
maqto'in na kanlang iti siza'on, ni'ang ita sanglav-samaq maqto siza'on.
S.TRANSL: 這裡的高麗菜可以收成了，那裡的昭和草就還不能收成。
The cabbage here is ready to be harvested, but the Showa grass there is not yet ready to be harvested.

S.FORM: ai! masu' madia a hutan sinkai.
ai! maso' madia a hotan sinkai.
S.TRANSL: 哇!你挖了這麼多的地瓜。
Wow! You dug up so many gourds.
Will you help me with the barn?

S.FORM: padangi cam mi ami' madamu ki iskan.
padangi cam mi ami' madamo ki iskan.
S.TRANSL: We’re releasing fishing nets to catch fish.

S.FORM: madia'in na iskan dinamu ha'an kalala'.
madia'in na iskan dinamo ha'an kalala'.
S.TRANSL: 魚簍裡已經抓了很多魚。
The fish basket has been full of fish.
How do you usually catch fish?

S.FORM: kucia cak ami' madamu ki iskan.
kocia cak ami' madamo ki iskan.
S.TRANSL: I use fish nets to replenish fish.
Do you know how to hunt with a bow and arrow?

S.FORM: maqanglac cak malhaqu, mintun madas cullku' cin acu' munba'av qanup.
maqanglac cak malhaqo, minton madas collko' cin aco' monba'av qanop.
S.TRANSL: 我通常都是用陷阱抓獵物，偶爾也會拿槍帶狗狩獵。
I usually catch my prey with a trap, but occasionally I hunt with a gun and a dog.

S.FORM: laqaqaiban ni vanis sa dan di.
laqaqaiban ni vanis sa dan di.
S.TRANSL: This is the road the boar took.

S.FORM: cia qa di vanis dapan, anangqa laqaqaiban aipi' vanis.
cia qa di vanis dapan, anangqa laqaqaiban aipi' vanis.
S.TRANSL: 這是山豬的腳印，所以這是山豬所走的路。
These are the footprints of the boar, so this is the path the boar took.

S.FORM: ina' hiqiv ata haqu', maupat haiza a tishaqu'.
ina' hiqiv ata haqo', maopat haiza a tishaqo'.
S.TRANSL: 快去看我們的陷阱，好像抓到獵物了。
Go and see our trap, for it seems that we have caught our prey.

S.FORM: maupat sak ka acu', i'na' hiav ata kantulun.
maopat sak ka aco', i'na' hiav ata kantolon.
S.TRANSL: 狗好像聞到味道了。我們快跟過去。
The dog seems to have smelled it. Let’s follow them.
你正在製作的是什麼東西?
這是石壓式陷阱，用來抓老鼠的。
This is a stone trap, used to catch rats.
你放在那裡的是什麼東西?
What is that thing you put there?

S.FORM: ma'aipa' a haqumucqut, malhaqu' ki cakut.
ma'aipa' a haqomocqot, malhaqo' ki cakot.
S.TRANSL: 那是套索式繩索陷阱，我們用它來抓山羌。
It was a lasso rope trap, and we used it to catch Shankiang.

S.FORM: matumasqing tamadiqanin, madia mita haip pa i'nama'.
matomasqing tamadiqanin, madia mita haip pa i'nama'.
S.TRANSL: 感謝祖靈賜福，今天我們有很多獵物收獲。
Thanks to the blessing of our ancestors, we had a great harvest today.

S.FORM: tuza'! dasun ita munacang kaskun paqusil!
toza'! dason ita monacang kaskon paqosil!
S.TRANSL: 是啊!我們帶回部落好好分享吧!
Yeah! Let’s take it back to the tribe and share it!

S.FORM: Maqa haip pa masnanava a na taqo mu'u tu maqu'q qa tesmutmut tupa.
Maqa haip pa masnanava a na taqo mo'o to maqo'q qa tesmotmot topa.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家動物的布農語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of animals in Bunun language today.

S.FORM: Maqa haip pa masnanava a na taqo mu'u tu maqa'q qa sincucuaz bazbaz.
Maqa haip pa masnanava a na taqo mo'o to maqa'q qa sincocoaz bazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家植物的布農語怎麼說。

S.FORM: Maqa haip pa masnanava a na taqo mu'u tu maqa'q qa kokonun tupa.
Maqa haip pa masnanava a na taqo mo'o to maqa'q qa kokonon topa.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師要教大家水果的布農語怎麼說。
I will teach everyone all kinds of fruits in Bunun language today.

S.FORM: Pintacali qa isu tu na patacan tu hung.
Pintacali qa iso to na patacan to hong.
Ni, icia naipa Damuq tu huluc.
Ni, icia naipa Damoq to holoc.
Sinis, uka cak madas si hung.
Sinis, oka cak madas si hong.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, I didn’t bring my textbook.

S.FORM: Muckuna qi tanciki su tu pantu sadu.
Mockona qi tanciki so to panto sado.
S.TRANSL: Share the book with your classmate next to you.

S.FORM: Pasimulan ku asu inak tu icqaqeseqs.
Pasimolan ko aso inak to icqaqeseqs.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser.

S.FORM: Na kanaqtunin ata sinpasnava, manunulun maca munlumaq tu dan!
Na kanaqtonin ata sinpasnava, manonolon maca monlomaq to dan!
S.TRANSL: 我們要下課了，回家路上要小心!
It is the end of the class, be careful on your way home.

S.FORM: Maca mudadan na asa tu kanaqduk, na muqnag ata pasatu.
Maca modadan na asa to kanaqdok, na moqnag ata pasato.
S.TRANSL: 走路要慢慢走，大家再見。

S.FORM: Uningan, ngan na tupaun tu Alang.
Uningan, ngan na topaon to Alang.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Abang.

S.FORM: Uningan, tupaun nak ngan tu Qavutaz.
Uningan, topaon nak ngan to Qavotaz.
S.TRANSL: Hello everyone, my name is Qavutaz.

S.FORM: Uningan, maq cak qa tupaun tu Lizu.
Uningan, maq cak qa topaon to Lizo.
Lizu uningan, maq cak qa Siqav.
Lizo oningan, maq cak qa Siqav.
Bizin uningan, maq cak qa Laung.
Bizin oningan, maq cak qa Laong.
Icia cak Tulbus tu tina, Uli cak.
Icia cak Tolbos to tina, Uli cak.
Icia cak Tulbus tu masinoba, tupaun nak ngan tu Langui.
Icia cak Tolbos to masinoba, topaon nak ngan to Langoi.
S.TRANSL: 我是Tulbus的妹妹，我的名字是Langui。
I am Tulbus’s sister. My name is Langui.

S.FORM: Inak naipa sinsi, tupaun cia qa ngan tu Tiang.
Inak naipa sinsi, topaon cia qa ngan to Tiang.
Inak naipa masitoqas, tupaun cia ngan tu Kimat.
Inak naipa masitoqas, topaon cia ngan to Kimat.
Tuqoun cia toqacbinanoaz su a ngan?
Toqoon cia toqacbinanoaz so a ngan?
S.TRANSL: What is your elder sister’s name?

S.FORM: Tupaun cia toqas nak qa ngan tu Salung.
Topaon cia toqas nak qa ngan to Salong.
S.TRANSL: My elder sister’s name is Salung.

S.FORM: Tuqoun cia nobabinanoaz su a ngan?
Toqoon cia nobabinanoaz so a ngan?
S.TRANSL: What is your younger sister’s name?

S.FORM: Tupaun cia masinoba nak qa ngan tu Tanivu.
Topaon cia masinoba nak qa ngan to Tanivo.
S.TRANSL: My younger sister’s name is Tanivu.

S.FORM: Qancip nopa asu ica tezakun tu ngan?
Qancip nopa aso ica tezakon to ngan?
Pin cia toqacbananaza su haip pa qamican?
Pin cia toqacbananaza so haip pa qamican?
S.TRANSL: How old is your elder brother?

S.FORM: Macan qan himain cia ta a qamican.
Macan qan himain cia ta a qamican.
Pin cia nobabananaza su a qamican?
Pin cia nobabananaza so a qamican?
S.TRANSL: How old is your younger brother?
Do you have schools in your community?

S.FORM: Ha'an asu acang mu tu kaku masipul?
Ha'an aso acang mo to kako masipol?
S.TRANSL: 你在部落的學校讀書嗎?
Do you study in your tribe’s school?

S.FORM: U, maczang tuza cam tastulumaq ican kakuta masipul.
U, maczang toza cam tastolomaq ican kakota masipol.
S.TRANSL: 是的，在學校讀書我們像一家人。
Yes, we are like family while we are studying at school.

S.FORM: Cimaq qa teza tu binanoaz zi?
Cimaq qa teza to binanoaz zi?

S.TRANSL: 你的媽媽從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: Maq cia tama su a kukuzaun?
Maq cia tama so a kokozaon?
S.TRANSL: 你的爸爸從事什麼工作?

S.FORM: Ni, ica naipun kaviaz nak tu masinoba.
Ni, ica naipon kaviaz nak to masinoba.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我弟弟的朋友。
No, he is my younger brother’s friend.
No, she is my younger sister.
How many people in their family?
There are five people in their family.
How many children in your family?
There are four children in our family.
How many younger siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Uka nak bananaz tu masinoba , heza tau binanoaz tu masinoba.
Uka nak bananaz to masinoba , heza tao binanoaz to masinoba.
S.TRANSL: 我沒有弟弟，有三位妹妹。
I don’t have any younger brothers, but I have three younger sisters.
How many older siblings do you have?
I don’t have any older siblings.
How many siblings do you have?

S.FORM: Maqa uvaukun na Bunun sidoq amin?
Maqa ovaokon na Bonon sidoq amin?
U, Bunun sidoq amin na uvaukun
U, Bonon sidoq amin na ovaokon
S.TRANSL: 是的，阿花也是布農族人。

S.FORM: Kama makazhav va diqanin, asa tu pide'un na danum baqec qu.
Kama makazhav va diqanin, asa to pide'on na danom baqec qo.
S.TRANSL: 天氣有點冷，要多喝熱水。
It’s a bit cold, so you need to drink more warm water.

S.FORM: Kama maklang nga diqanin, asa tu pide'un na danum qu.
Kama maklang nga diqanin, asa to pide'on na danom qo.
S.TRANSL: It’s a bit hot, so you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: Maqa'q qa nata' tu diqanin sadu'an?
Maqa'q qa nata' to diqanin sado'an?
Sanvali'an sala, asa nitu sipungul pinuqan madoqpuc tu huluc cin tamuhungan na nitu sanvali'an.
Sanvali'an sala, asa nito sipongol pinoqan madoqpoc to holoc cin tamohongan na nito sanvali'an.
S.TRANSL: 太陽很大，要記得穿長袖及戴帽子防曬。
The sun is bright and remember to wear sunscreen.

S.FORM: Uka a vali, qai tu minbongqul la luhum ha'an diqaninta.
Uka a vali, qai to minbongqol la lohom ha'an diqaninta.
S.TRANSL: There are a lot of clouds but no sun in the sky.

S.FORM: Na luhuman cin luvluvan dau laqbing, u'ka amin na vali.
Na lohoman cin lovlovan dao laqbing, o'ka amin na vali.
S.TRANSL: 明天沒有太陽，雲很多，風很大。
It will be cloudy and windy but not sunny tomorrow.
How was the weather that day?

S.FORM: Maca tudipin na diqanin lau qa makazhav, maca munata a asa tu pinuqan makatpal tu huluc.
Maca todipin na diqanin lao qa makazhav, maca monata a asa to pinoqan makatpal to holoc.
S.TRANSL: 這天有點冷，出門要穿外套。
It was a bit cold and you needed to wear a jacket when you went outside.

S.FORM: Maqu'q dau ka pal'un tu diqanin?
Maqo'q dao ka pal'on to diqanin?
S.TRANSL: How’s the weather on the weekend?

S.FORM: Sanvali'an dau ka diqanin maca pal'unin.
Sanvali'an dao ka diqanin maca pal'onin.
S.TRANSL: It will be sunny on the weekend.
Will it be rainy that day?

S.FORM: Sanvali'an dau ka diqanin maca tudipin, na nitu qudanan.
Sanvali'an dao ka diqanin maca todipin, na nito qodanan.
S.TRANSL: 那天天氣晴朗，不會下雨。
It will have no rain and be sunny that day.
Will it be rainy that day?
Yes, it will be rainy that day.

S.FORM: Isdangdah in lopaku, minsuma'in na vali.
Isdangdah in lopako, minsoma'in na vali.
S.TRANSL: The rain stops and the sun comes out.

S.FORM: Qudanan'in lopaku ka, uka cak madac talulung.
Qodanan'in lopako ka, oka cak madac talolong.
S.TRANSL: 現在正在下雨了，我沒有帶傘。
It is raining and I don’t have an umbrella with me.

S.FORM: Uka lopaku qudanan, qaitu maca dinonquvali kin na qudanan, asatu madas si talulung maca munata.
Uka lopako qodanan, qaito maca dinonqovali kin na qodanan, asato madas si talolong maca monata.
S.TRANSL: 現在沒有下雨，中午過後會下雨，出門要帶傘。
It is not raining now, but it will be rainy in the afternoon, so you need to bring an umbrella when you go out.

S.FORM: Makazhav nopa moqnin qamisan tu minqamisan?
Makazhav nopa moqnin qamisan to minqamisan?
S.TRANSL: Will it be very cold in winter next year?

S.FORM: U, makazhav sala dau ki moqnin qamican, asatu pite'un na huluc penuk.
U, makazhav sala dao ki moqnin qamican, asato pite'on na holoc penok.
S.TRANSL: 是，明年冬天會很冷，要穿很多衣服。
Yes, it will be very cold in winter next year, so you need to put on extra layers.
Will it be very hot in summer this year?

S.FORM: Lauqa, asa tu pide'un na danum qo, mopa i maklang maca tanabalin na deqanin.
Laoqa, asa to pide'on na danom qo, mopa i maklang maca tanabalin na deqanin.
S.TRANSL: 有可能，夏天會很熱，要多喝水。
Yes, it will be very hot and you need to drink more water.

S.FORM: U, madu cak mintanabal, opa i manangqat ta deqanin.
U, mado cak mintanabal, opa i manangqat ta deqanin.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡春天，天氣很溫暖。
I like spring because the weather is warm.

S.FORM: Ni, ni caka asa minmakazhav, opa i madia a luvluv.
Ni, ni caka asa minmakazhav, opa i madia a lovlov.
S.TRANSL: 我不喜歡秋天，秋天有好多颱風。
I don’t like autumn because there are lots of typhoons in autumn.
I forgot to bring the textbook.
I will share it with you.
I forgot to bring the eraser.
Do you forget to bring your pen?

S.FORM: U, maqtuan pasimul zaku ki inpicu?
U, maqtoan pasimol zako ki inpico?
S.TRANSL: Yes, can you lend me a pen?

S.FORM: Maq'aq suu tungqovali ka na konun?
Maq'aq soo tongqovali ka na konon?
S.TRANSL: What would you like for lunch?
What would you like for dinner?
What did you have for breakfast?
What did you have for lunch?
你先去，我等一下去找你。
You go first and I will catch up later.

S.FORM: Ni, ngusang cam ancaqan ngi petasan.
Ni, ngosang cam ancaqan ngi petasan.
S.TRANSL: No, we have to carry books first.
Not yet. I am doing the dishes.
Did you rinse out your mouth?
Yes, I rinsed out my mouth.
Why didn’t you wash your hands?
I will wash my hands later.
What were you doing just now?
I went to meet the teacher.
What are you going to do after school?

S.FORM: Na malqama'qa naipa maca pudanun'in kaku?
Na malqama'qa naipa maca podanon'in kako?
S.TRANSL: What is she doing after school?
She is going to go dancing.

S.FORM: Uka a Langui lumaq, Savi cak, ma'aq qa sinkuzakuza nah? na takuaq' ku ka Langui.
Uka a Langoi lomaq, Savi cak, ma'aq qa sinkozakoza nah? na takoaq' ko ka Langoi.
S.TRANSL: Langui不在家耶!我是Savi，有什麼事嗎? 回來我會轉告Langui。
Langui is not at home. I am Savi. What can I do for you? I will let him know when he comes back.

S.FORM: Qodacno'az, sani cak cin Abu, kangzin cam matua ki hilav!
Qodacno'az, sani cak cin Abo, kangzin cam matoa ki hilav!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶，我們是Sani和 Abu，幫我們開門!
Grandma, we are Sani and Abu, please open the door for us.
I am Laung, I am here for Tiang.
Grandma, I am here to see you.

S.FORM: Delmudin casu uka munidi, miliskin sala cak su.
Delmodin caso oka monidi, miliskin sala cak so.
S.TRANSL: 你好久沒來了，我好想念你。
You haven’t been here for a long time. I missed you so much.

S.FORM: Umav, munidi cak kilim su paqaqenan.
Umav, monidi cak kilim so paqaqenan.
S.TRANSL: Umav , I am here to play with you.

S.FORM: Kavain munkunbu lumaq, delmudin cak mal'u su nah.
Kavain monkonbo lomaq, delmodin cak mal'o so nah.
S.TRANSL: 快進來家裡，我等你好久。
Come on in! I have been waiting for you for a long time.

S.FORM: Inak naipi sincuaz tu hutan, tanami ma'un!
Inak naipi sincoaz to hotan, tanami ma'on!
S.TRANSL: 這是我種的地瓜，吃吃看!
This is the sweet potato I grow. Try it!

S.FORM: Un, madavc sa hutan di konun.
Un, madavc sa hotan di konon.
S.TRANSL: The sweet potato is so sweet.

S.FORM: Hanuin, inak nganki sincucuaz tu kut'aqon, tanami ma'un.
Hanoin, inak nganki sincocoaz to kot'aqon, tanami ma'on.
S.TRANSL: 過來!這是我種的水果，吃看看。
Come here! These are the fruits I grow. You should try it.

S.FORM: Malungku! Inak nepi sincuaz tu tipul, uka makuca helu, tanami ma'un!
Malongko! Inak nepi sincoaz to tipol, oka makoca helo, tanami ma'on!
S.TRANSL: 請坐! 這是我種的有機玉米吃看看!
Take a seat! You should try some organic corn that I grow.

S.FORM: Ua! Tututza tu madavc sala za tipul li.
Ua! Tototza to madavc sala za tipol li.
S.TRANSL: Wow! The corn tastes so sweet.

S.FORM: Nicak maqatu ma'un ni izuk, mang'un cak cia bunbun na konun.
Nicak maqato ma'on ni izok, mang'on cak cia bonbon na konon.
S.TRANSL: 我不能吃橘子，我吃香蕉就好。
I can’t eat oranges. I will have some apples instead.
Sure, I like it very much.
Let me peel the papaya for you.

S.FORM: Miqomicang, madeia cia salitung di ka vuc.
Miqomicang, madeia cia salitong di ka voc.
S.TRANSL: Thank you. This papaya is so juicy.
I will bring you some water.

S.FORM: Pidei ma'un, madeia nak ka sinhanat sanglav.
Pidei ma'on, madeia nak ka sinhanat sanglav.
S.TRANSL: Enjoy yourself. I cooked a lot of dishes.

S.FORM: Uu! Tuza tu mahancum macihal amin konun.
Uo! Toza to mahancom macihal amin konon.
S.TRANSL: 嗚! 真的很香也好吃。
Oh! It smells good and looks delicious.
Enjoy yourself. There is a lot more.
I’ll make myself at home then.
Enjoy yourself. There are plenty here.

S.FORM: Laqatuanin cak, ni cak maqatu ukonan i.
Laqatoanin cak, ni cak maqato okonan i.
S.TRANSL: 我吃了好多，不能再吃了。
I ate a lot and couldn’t eat any more.

S.FORM: Na dasun amu haip sinsi munludun ta dadan.
Na dason amo haip sinsi monlodon ta dadan.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去山上走走。
I will take you to the mountains today.

S.FORM: Tupa ka tina tu madeia a ludunta qatibing.
Topa ka tina to madeia a lodonta qatibing.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說山上有很多蚊子。
Mom says that there are lots of mosquitoes in the mountains.

S.FORM: Adasun amu haip sinsi munhan qomata munqoma.
Adason amo haip sinsi monhan qomata monqoma.
S.TRANSL: 老師今天要帶你們去田裡工作。
I will take you to the fields.

S.FORM: Na macuqaz cata qoma tu dalaq?
Na macoqaz cata qoma to dalaq?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to loosen the soil?

S.FORM: Adasun cata sinsi munha'an vanglaz mudadan.
Adason cata sinsi monha'an vanglaz modadan.
S.TRANSL: 老師要帶我們去河邊走走。
Teacher will take us to the riverside.

S.FORM: Na dasun cata sinsi munludun ta kilim mi qodu.
Na dason cata sinsi monlodon ta kilim mi qodo.
S.TRANSL: 老師要帶我們去山上找龍葵菜。
Teacher will take us to the mountains today.

S.FORM: Munha'an cata haip dau vanglaz ta?
Monha'an cata haip dao vanglaz ta?
S.TRANSL: Are we going to the riverside today?

S.FORM: Ni, adasun ata sinsi munludun ta.
Ni, adason ata sinsi monlodon ta.
S.TRANSL: 不是，老師要帶我們去山上。
No, our teacher is going to take us to the mountains.
Are we going to the mountains today?
不是，我們今天要去田裡。
No, we are going to the fields.

S.FORM: Masnanava, ma'aq mita sadu'an ha'an vanglazta cunah?
Masnanava, ma'aq mita sado'an ha'an vanglazta conah?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到河邊要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see at the riverside?
We are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: Masnanava, ma'aq mita sadu'an ha'an ludunta cunah?
Masnanava, ma'aq mita sado'an ha'an lodonta conah?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們到山上要看什麼?
Teacher, what are we going to see in the mountains?
We are going to see butterflies.
What are we going to do in the fields?

S.FORM: Munha'an ata qoma sadu ki imta sincuaz tu tipul, asatu malnanulu na heza a qalua cin vanu qai!
Monha'an ata qoma sado ki imta sincoaz to tipol, asato malnanolo na heza a qaloa cin vano qai!
S.TRANSL: 我們要到田裡看我們種的玉米，要小心有螞蟻、蜜蜂唷!
We are going to see the corn we grow in the fields, but you need to be aware of the ants and bees.

S.FORM: Masnanava, munha'an cata vanglazta lingqaul nobah?
Masnanava, monha'an cata vanglazta lingqaol nobah?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們要到河邊游泳嗎?
Teacher, are we going to swim in the river?

S.FORM: Ni, na madamu ata ki iskan.
Ni, na madamo ata ki iskan.
S.TRANSL: No, we are going to see dragonflies.

S.FORM: Sinsi, munha'an cata qomata macuaz zi sanglav?
Sinsi, monha'an cata qomata macoaz zi sanglav?
S.TRANSL: 老師，我們要到田裡種菜嗎?
Teacher, are we going to grow some vegetables in the fields?
We are going to loosen the soil today.

S.FORM: Lopan cak haip sadu ki mamantuk miqomic tu qalindis.
Lopan cak haip sado ki mamantok miqomic to qalindis.
S.TRANSL: 我今天才看過真正活著的蜻蜓。
Today is the first time I see real living dragonflies.
看，那裡有蝴蝶飛來飛去。

S.FORM: Uu! Ua! Madu cak ki talikuan opa i manoaz sadu'an.
Uo! Ua! Mado cak ki talikoan opa i manoaz sado'an.
S.TRANSL: 耶! 哇! 我喜歡蝴蝶因為看起來很漂亮。
Yeh! Wow! I love butterflies. They are very beautiful.
Those are not butterflies. They are bees.

S.FORM: Muaz qai i'idi sadu ka, nitu munun daqavican ta!
Moaz qai i'idi sado ka, nito monon daqavican ta!
S.TRANSL: 在這裡看一看，不要到太遠的地方唷!
Come here and take a look. Don’t go too far!

S.FORM: U, na ni cam mundaqavican ta mudadan.
U, na ni cam mondaqavican ta modadan.
S.TRANSL: 好，我們不會去太遠的地方。
Got it, we won’t go anywhere too far.

S.FORM: Qa'a tu tindangkul, qanakduk ka mudadan deqe mutingkul.
Qa'a to tindangkol, qanakdok ka modadan deqe motingkol.
S.TRANSL: 不要用跑的，慢慢走免得跌倒了。
Don’t run and walk slowly lest you fall down.

S.FORM: Asa cak kavava sadu ki talikuan.
Asa cak kavava sado ki talikoan.
S.TRANSL: I want to see them right away.
How do you go to the block-house?
How does he go to the hospital?
How do you go to Taitung?
I go to Penghu by plane.
I go to Penghu by Lanyu.
I go to Penghu by Lanyu.

S.FORM: Ma'aq ca Danivu'un na dazan munha'an pasnanavan ta?
Ma'aq ca Danivo'on na dazan monha'an pasnanavan ta?
S.TRANSL: How does Danivu go to school?
Danivu goes to school by train.
How does Usung go to church?
Usung goes to church by bicycle.
Do you go to school by MRT?
No, I go to school by bus.
Do you go to school by bicycle?
Yes, I go to school by bicycle.
Do you go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail?
Yes, I go to Kaohsiung by High Speed Rail.

S.FORM: Tunlehlehkisia casu munha'an taitu doqe tunhekuki?
Tonlehlehkisia caso monha'an taito doqe tonhekoki?
S.TRANSL: 你去台東搭火車還是搭飛機?
Are you going to Taitung by train or by plane?

S.FORM: Tunhikuki cak, mopa i tan na hikuki i lehlehkisia mahiav.
Tonhikoki cak, mopa i tan na hikoki i lehlehkisia mahiav.
S.TRANSL: 我搭飛機，因為搭飛機比搭火車快。
I will take the plane because it is faster than the train.

S.FORM: Tunlehlehqatumu casu munha'an kukai doqe anak untin lehleh?
Tonlehlehqatomo caso monha'an kokai doqe anak ontin lehleh?
S.TRANSL: 你去教會搭公車還是自己開車?
Are you going to drive to the church or take the bus?

S.FORM: Na untin cak lehleh mukukai, mopa i maca anak manutinlehleh ka tani dazalehlehqatumu mastan kandang.
Na ontin cak lehleh mokokai, mopa i maca anak manotinlehleh ka tani dazalehlehqatomo mastan kandang.
S.TRANSL: 我開車去教會，因為開車比搭公車方便。
I will drive to the church because it is more convenient than the bus.

S.FORM: Michuan na babalivan ni lumaq mu?
Michoan na babalivan ni lomaq mo?
S.TRANSL: Is the market close to your house?

S.FORM: Ni'i, Amin cak tunutuvia muha'an babalivanta.
Ni'i, Amin cak tonotovia moha'an babalivanta.
S.TRANSL: 並沒有，我都騎摩托車去超市。
No, it is not, so I always ride the motorcycle to the market.
Is the post office close to the school?

S.FORM: Michuan sala, muaz tunpantac sa na kadipin.
Michoan sala, moaz tonpantac sa na kadipin.
S.TRANSL: Yes, it is within walking distance.

S.FORM: Michuan na Kakounan ngi panduanlehleh ta?
Michoan na Kakoonan ngi pandoanlehleh ta?
S.TRANSL: Is the restaurant close to the station?

S.FORM: Mintasal li panduanlehleh moqnan munmai mudan hima zikang nga na.
Mintasal li pandoanlehleh moqnan monmai modan hima zikang nga na.
S.TRANSL: 出車站再走五分鐘就到了。
It only takes five minutes after you walk out of the station.
I would like to visit you.

S.FORM: Heza nak haip pa sinkuzakuza. aza'qa moqnin.
Heza nak haip pa sinkozakoza. aza'qa moqnin.
S.TRANSL: 我今天有事不在家。改天吧。
I am out today. How about another day?

S.FORM: Na heza su laqbing zikang? Maca tungqovalikin na kilimuku asu.
Na heza so laqbing zikang? Maca tongqovalikin na kilimoko aso.
S.TRANSL: 那你明天有空嗎?我下午去找你。
Then, are you available tomorrow? I’ll visit you tomorrow afternoon.

S.FORM: Maqatu, na iha'an cak lumaq mal'u su.
Maqato, na iha'an cak lomaq mal'o so.
S.TRANSL: Sure, I will wait for you at home.

S.FORM: Maqatu cak makucia kikai siza isu tu qalinga? Na binuniun ku paitacan.
Maqato cak makocia kikai siza iso to qalinga? Na binonion ko paitacan.
S.TRANSL: 請問我可以使用機器錄你的聲音嗎?我想做紀錄。
Would you mind if I do the voice recording? I would like to keep a record.
Would you mind if I do the video recording?

S.FORM: Ni cak manoaz sadu'an, ni amin na suku pinizavun, aza'qa nitu siza qaningu.
Ni cak manoaz sado'an, ni amin na soko pinizavon, aza'qa nito siza qaningo.
S.TRANSL: 我不好看，倉庫也沒整理，不要錄影啦。
No, I am plain and the warehouse hasn’t been tidied up yet.
Then I will just take photos.

S.FORM: Mikomicang maqtu'an cak muckun su palakancipa.
Mikomicang maqto'an cak mockon so palakancipa.
S.TRANSL: Thank you for accepting the interview.

S.FORM: Nitu makuaq, maqa su a asaun masingav dau?
Nito makoaq, maqa so a asaon masingav dao?
S.TRANSL: You are welcome. What would you like to know?

S.FORM: Malqamaq' asu tu talmindu ka sinkuzakuza?
Malqamaq' aso to talmindo ka sinkozakoza?
S.TRANSL: 請問您年輕時是做什麼的?
What do you do when you are young?

S.FORM: Kisacu' cak qabas'can qaitu mal'ukin cak lopaku.
Kisaco' cak qabas'can qaito mal'okin cak lopako.
S.TRANSL: 我以前是警察，但我現在退休了。
I was a police officer but I am retired now.
Then, are you working at the moment?

S.FORM: Ha'an amin su'u a uva'az acang miqomic?
Ha'an amin so'o a ova'az acang miqomic?
S.TRANSL: 請問您的孩子也住在部落生活嗎?
Do your kids live in the tribe too?

S.FORM: Ni, ha'an nak ka uvava'az natata miqomic.
Ni, ha'an nak ka ovava'az natata miqomic.
S.TRANSL: 不，我的孩子在都市居住。
No, my kids are all living in the city.

S.FORM: Na tatini qana asu ha'an lumaq ki?
Na tatini qana aso ha'an lomaq ki?
S.TRANSL: Then, do you live by yourself?

S.FORM: Heza cak sepuk tac'a acu cin loqe, inak amin ngka tactulumqa.
Heza cak sepok tac'a aco cin loqe, inak amin ngka tactolomqa.
S.TRANSL: 我還有養一隻狗和一隻鳥，他們也是我的家人。
I also keep a dog and a bird. They are my family.

S.FORM: Heza amin cak sepuk tac'a ngaung, nitu macmuav qalimulmul maca heza a sinsepuk.
Heza amin cak sepok tac'a ngaong, nito macmoav qalimolmol maca heza a sinsepok.
S.TRANSL: 我也有養一隻貓，有動物陪伴不會孤單寂寞。
I have a cat too. I won’t get bored with the company of my pet.

S.FORM: Asa cak macingav su paliuni ki qanup tu samu.
Asa cak macingav so palioni ki qanop to samo.
S.TRANSL: 我想請問你關於打獵的禁忌。
I would like to ask you about the taboos of hunting.

S.FORM: Ni nak madeia a qancepun, qaitu maca qancepuk ku ka na aminun ku taqo su.
Ni nak madeia a qancepon, qaito maca qancepok ko ka na aminon ko taqo so.
S.TRANSL: 我知道的不多，但我所知道的都會回答你。
I don’t know much about that, but I will tell you everything I know.

S.FORM: Maqa mu a isqanup tu busul la, heza maqa' tu samu?
Maqa mo a isqanop to bosol la, heza maqa' to samo?
S.TRANSL: 你們打獵的獵槍，有什麼禁忌嗎?
Do you have any taboos about hunting weapons?

S.FORM: Ma nam ma busul la ni a binanoaz maqatu katidu.
Ma nam ma bosol la ni a binanoaz maqato katido.
S.TRANSL: 我們打獵的獵槍不可以讓女生碰到。
Our hunting weapons are untouchable to women.

S.FORM: Na maqatu a binanoaz lavi qanup?
Na maqato a binanoaz lavi qanop?
S.TRANSL: 那女人可以一起去打獵嗎?
Then, can women go hunting together?

S.FORM: Nitumaqtu, ni amin na binanoaz maqatu hamu qanup.
Nitomaqto, ni amin na binanoaz maqato hamo qanop.
S.TRANSL: 不行，女人也不可以打獵。
No, women cannot go hunting either.

S.FORM: Sai, ukain na lumaq davuc , inain casu mabaliv vi davuc.
Sai, okain na lomaq davoc , inain caso mabaliv vi davoc.
S.TRANSL: Sai，家裡沒有米酒了，你去買米酒。
Sai, our home is out of rice wine, please go and buy some.

S.FORM: Hezang tac'a pan ha'an pit'ai'an ta, maqatu nitu mabaliv o!
Hezang tac'a pan ha'an pit'ai'an ta, maqato nito mabaliv o!
S.TRANSL: 廚房裡還有一瓶，可以不用買吧!
There is still one bottle left in the kitchen, so there is no need to buy one!

S.FORM: Mavia i muaz tac'a pan, muqnag baliv tusa pan.
Mavia i moaz tac'a pan, moqnag baliv tosa pan.
S.TRANSL: One bottle is not enough for me, go and buy two more back.

S.FORM: Mabaliv cak davuc, heza amu babaliv?
Mabaliv cak davoc, heza amo babaliv?
S.TRANSL: 我要買米酒，你們有賣嗎?
I am looking for rice wine. Do you have any rice wine?

S.FORM: Heza i, piaq su a balivun?
Heza i, piaq so a balivon?
S.TRANSL: Yes! How many bottles do you need?

S.FORM: Mabaliv cak tusa pan, hezang tac'a kapa tu tilac.
Mabaliv cak tosa pan, hezang tac'a kapa to tilac.
S.TRANSL: 我要買兩瓶，還要買一包米。
I want two bottles and a pack of rice.

S.FORM: Idi a tilac ci, hezang su maqa' qa na balivun?
Idi a tilac ci, hezang so maqa' qa na balivon?
S.TRANSL: 米在這裡，你還需要什麼嗎?
Here is the rice, what else do you need?

S.FORM: Na balivan cak ki qepuan, heza mu balivun?
Na balivan cak ki qepoan, heza mo balivon?
S.TRANSL: I want some eggs too, do you have some?
I want to buy some clothes.
What kind of clothes do you like?

S.FORM: Mabaliv cak maputul pakima'un tu huluc.
Mabaliv cak mapotol pakima'on to holoc.
S.TRANSL: I want to buy the clothes with short sleeves.

S.FORM: Maqkuqa qa madangqac di saduan su?
Maqkoqa qa madangqac di sadoan so?

S.TRANSL: We have white and blue ones too.

S.FORM: Avin cak tac'a masanglav tu huluc.
Avin cak tac'a masanglav to holoc.
S.TRANSL: 請給我一件藍色的衣服。
Please give me the clothes in blue.

S.FORM: Laung in'iack casu sangan cunah? Pintatamasaz casu hubung?
Laong in'iack caso sangan conah? Pintatamasaz caso hobong?
S.TRANSL: Laung你剛剛去哪裡了?你去運動嗎?
Laung, where have you been just now? Did you go exercising?

S.FORM: Ni, qatangaz cak qodacnoaz babalivi sanglav.
Ni, qatangaz cak qodacnoaz babalivi sanglav.
S.TRANSL: No, I went grocery shopping for my grandma.

S.FORM: O~ mopataqana, heza nopa su sanavan ziqan? Maqatu cata muckun ma'un sanavan.
O~ mopataqana, heza nopa so sanavan ziqan? Maqato cata mockon ma'on sanavan.
S.TRANSL: 喔~這樣啊，你晚上有沒有空?和我一起吃飯吧。
No wonder! Are you available at night? Would you like to have a meal with me?

S.FORM: Nitumqtu, na tan cak mabaliv vi huluc.
Nitomqto, na tan cak mabaliv vi holoc.
S.TRANSL: No, I want to buy some clothes.
Then, I will go with you.

S.FORM: Uninag, piaq qa sanglav vi cui?
Uninag, piaq qa sanglav vi coi?
S.TRANSL: 你好，請問這把菜多少錢?
Hello, how much is this bunch of vegetables?

S.FORM: Mapusan cui qa sanglav maca tac'a linoqouc.
Maposan coi qa sanglav maca tac'a linoqooc.
S.TRANSL: The vegetables are $20 for a bunch.
How much are these sweet potatoes?
Sweet potatoes are thirty dollars for a pound.

S.FORM: Mabaliv cak tusa sanglav cin tac'a tingting tu hutan.
Mabaliv cak tosa sanglav cin tac'a tingting to hotan.
S.TRANSL: 我買兩把菜和一斤地瓜。
Please give me two bunches of vegetables and a pound of sweet potatoes.

S.FORM: Lizu, sibunul cak madac ispapatac, maqtuan asu pasimul zaku?
Lizo, sibonol cak madac ispapatac, maqtoan aso pasimol zako?
S.TRANSL: Lizu，我忘了帶筆，你可以借我嗎?
Lizu, I forgot to bring my pen. Can you lend me one?

S.FORM: Uka amin nak ica naipi Sani'un.
Uka amin nak ica naipi Sani'on.
S.TRANSL: I don’t have one either. This is Sani’s.

S.FORM: Maqtuan pasimulin zaku? Na mahiav sala cak macuqas pesu.
Maqtoan pasimolin zako? Na mahiav sala cak macoqas peso.
S.TRANSL: 那可以借我一下子嗎?我很快就還你。
Can you lend me the pen for a second? I will return to you immediately.

S.FORM: Miqomicang, qangzin amin cak tupa ki Sani tu miqomicang.
Miqomicang, qangzin amin cak topa ki Sani to miqomicang.
S.TRANSL: Thank you and thank Sani for me.

S.FORM: Maq nak ka maqtu qadandaz su?
Maq nak ka maqto qadandaz so?
Na macuqas cak tusa paitacan diki.
Na macoqas cak tosa paitacan diki.
S.TRANSL: I want to return these two books.

S.FORM: Un, hezang nopa duma hung asaun su simul?
Un, hezang nopa doma hong asaon so simol?
S.TRANSL: 好的，是否還有其它書籍你想要借的嗎?
Okay, are there any other books you want to borrow?
I would like to borrow these three books.

S.FORM: Maqtu'in, ma maca miqan na nitu minpunul munit macoqes hung qai.
Maqto'in, ma maca miqan na nito minponol monit macoqes hong qai.
S.TRANSL: 好了，記得後天書要拿來還。
Sure and remember to return them after three days.

S.FORM: Ni'an asu macoqes zaku ki isqaqesqes.
Ni'an aso macoqes zako ki isqaqesqes.
S.TRANSL: You haven’t returned me the eraser.

S.FORM: Na mavia tu munhav nak qa isqaqesqes i.
Na mavia to monhav nak qa isqaqesqes i.
S.TRANSL: 那我的橡皮擦怎麼不見了。
Then, why is my eraser missing?

S.FORM: Doqe pasimulun su ki Lukus o.
Doqe pasimolon so ki Lokos o.
S.TRANSL: Did you lend it to Lukus?

S.FORM: Ni amin cak qanciap, singavan'an zaku.
Ni amin cak qanciap, singavan'an zako.
S.TRANSL: 我不知道。我先去問問她。
I don’t know. I will go and ask her.

S.FORM: Ngucan cak pasimul su ki inak tu icqaqesqes.
Ngocan cak pasimol so ki inak to icqaqesqes.
S.TRANSL: I will lend you my eraser first.

S.FORM: Sani, ica qa hulus qabang ngi Lukus sinpacimul su'u?
Sani, ica qa holos qabang ngi Lokos sinpacimol so'o?
S.TRANSL: Sani, did Lukus lend you this coat?

S.FORM: Ni i, ica naipi tina nak sinbaliv penak.
Ni i, ica naipi tina nak sinbaliv penak.
S.TRANSL: 不是啊，這是我媽媽買給我的
No, my mom bought it for me.

S.FORM: Maqa cia Lukus tu huluc qabang nga maczang isu.
Maqa cia Lokos to holoc qabang nga maczang iso.
S.TRANSL: ’s coat is the same as yours.

S.FORM: Maqa cia ka huluc qabang nga mataqdung, ni nam maczang nga paitacan.
Maqa cia ka holoc qabang nga mataqdong, ni nam maczang nga paitacan.
S.TRANSL: 他的外套是黑色的，我們的顏色不一樣。
His coat is black, so our colors are different.

S.FORM: Sani, heza asu muckun Lukus simuli cui?
Sani, heza aso mockon Lokos simoli coi?
S.TRANSL: Sani, did you borrow money from Lukus?

S.FORM: Heza, al coqesun zaku haip pa, minpunul cak madac cui.
Heza, al coqeson zako haip pa, minponol cak madac coi.
S.TRANSL: 有，我本來今天要還他，我忘記帶錢了。
Yes, I was supposed to return to him today, but I forgot to bring the money.
Then, when will you return the money?
I will return to him tomorrow.

S.FORM: U, na qangzak asu taqo ki Lukus.
U, na qangzak aso taqo ki Lokos.
S.TRANSL: Okay, I will tell Lukus for you.

S.FORM: Mamaca matamu ki qamutic sa asatu makucia ki qatu', maqa tikulac ca asatu makucia ki haqo mucqut, mopata a mamangtuk.
Mamaca matamo ki qamotic sa asato makocia ki qato', maqa tikolac ca asato makocia ki haqo mocqot, mopata a mamangtok.
S.TRANSL: 老鼠應該要⽤⽯壓式陷阱抓，⽵雞應該要⽤套頸式陷阱抓，這樣才對。
It is correct to catch mice through rangay and catch bamboo partridges through qjiulang.

S.FORM: Mopataqana, muliva qana cak, banaqa ni cak udamuan.
Mopataqana, moliva qana cak, banaqa ni cak odamoan.
S.TRANSL: 原來是這樣，我都搞錯了！難怪我都抓不到。
No wonder! I am mistaken and that’s why I cannot catch any of them.

S.FORM: Na moqnang cak taqo su tu makuqa' matac'i tusa haqo ti.
Na moqnang cak taqo so to makoqa' matac'i tosa haqo ti.
S.TRANSL: 那我再教你怎麼製作這兩種陷阱。
Then I will teach you how to set up these two traps.

S.FORM: Machal maca mopata! Na utamuanin cak sikupa tu tesmumut maca qabasing.
Machal maca mopata! Na otamoanin cak sikopa to tesmomot maca qabasing.
S.TRANSL: 這樣子太棒了！這樣我以後就會抓到獵物了。
Great! I will be able to catch the prey in the future.

S.FORM: Masmutin sala qa qoma, munhana sukuta siza i kaul, na munha'an ata qomata.
Masmotin sala qa qoma, monhana sokota siza i kaol, na monha'an ata qomata.
S.TRANSL: 田裡的草已經雜草叢生了，你去倉庫拿鐮刀，我們去田裡。
The grass in the fields is too tall. Go to the warehouse to take the sickle and let’s go to the fields.

S.FORM: Hani qapung tu siki a, maca munkunbu asu suku na usatu'anin.
Hani qapong to siki a, maca monkonbo aso soko na osato'anin.
S.TRANSL: 在圓簍的旁邊，你進去倉庫就會看到了。
It is next to the round basket. You will see it when you enter the warehouse.

S.FORM: Mananulu ki siza, manucqet ta kaul, sadu'du na milulu.
Mananolo ki siza, manocqet ta kaol, sado'do na milolo.
S.TRANSL: 小心拿，鐮刀很利，小心不要受傷。
Be careful and don’t get hurt. The sickle is very sharp.

S.FORM: Qa'a tu kandapan inak tu haqo!
Qa'a to kandapan inak to haqo!
I'icaq qa sintac'i su tu haqo?
I'icaq qa sintac'i so to haqo?
Manak haqo qa iha'an nastu teza tu lukic.
Manak haqo qa iha'an nasto teza to lokic.
S.TRANSL: 我的陷阱在那棵樹的下面。
My trap is under that tree.

S.FORM: Heza' nak sintas'i pasqu iti, pangqa qanciap cak tu icaqa nak ka haqu.
Heza' nak sintas'i pasqo iti, pangqa qanciap cak to icaqa nak ka haqo.
S.TRANSL: 我在這邊有做記號，因此我知道我的陷阱在哪裡。
I make a mark here, so I know where my trap is.

S.FORM: Maqa di ka saluzu' ina munhan ata vanglazta valu'iskan.
Maqa di ka salozo' ina monhan ata vanglazta valo'iskan.
S.TRANSL: 這是魚籠，我們去溪邊捕魚。
This is a fish trap which we put beside the river for fishing.

S.FORM: Uka nam idi saluzu', amin cam makucia ki paniza' damu iskan.
Uka nam idi salozo', amin cam makocia ki paniza' damo iskan.
S.TRANSL: 我們那邊沒有魚筌，我們都用釣竿抓魚。
We don’t have any fish traps there, so we catch fish with a fishing rod.

S.FORM: Ni'ang cak mekucia ki paniza', maqatu asu masnava zaku maca moqnin?
Ni'ang cak mekocia ki paniza', maqato aso masnava zako maca moqnin?
S.TRANSL: 我沒有用過釣竿，你下次教我好嗎?
I have never used a fishing rod before, would you mind teaching me next time?

S.FORM: U, maca moqnin na muckun cata malasqan.
U, maca moqnin na mockon cata malasqan.
S.TRANSL: 好啊!我們下次一起去釣魚。
Sure! Let’s go fishing together next time.

S.FORM: Maca moqnin na masnava cak sutu makuqa' matas'i saluzu'.
Maca moqnin na masnava cak soto makoqa' matas'i salozo'.
S.TRANSL: I will teach you how to make a fish trap next time.

S.FORM: Bicukbicukin su a paniza', doqe hezin na iskan kalat! kavavain sibutbut paniza' su.
Bicokbicokin so a paniza', doqe hezin na iskan kalat! kavavain sibotbot paniza' so.
S.TRANSL: 你的釣竿動了，是不是有魚上鉤了!你快拉釣竿起來。
Your fishing rod is moving. Isn’t the fish on the hook? Pull it up!

S.FORM: Mal'uang, mastan na qatu' vindoqvindoq. I'id cak sibutbut ti paniza', sepa casu deza kadangaz zaku siza' i ami'.
Mal'oang, mastan na qato' vindoqvindoq. I'id cak sibotbot ti paniza', sepa caso deza kadangaz zako siza' i ami'.
S.TRANSL: 等等，船太晃了。我在這邊拉釣竿，你去那邊幫我拿網子來。
Wait, the ship is rolling heavily. I am here to pull the fishing rod and you should go there to grab me the net.

S.FORM: Silulu' i su a iskan sepa zaku'an di. Na kadangazku asu sibutbut.
Silolo' i so a iskan sepa zako'an di. Na kadangazko aso sibotbot.
S.TRANSL: 你把魚拉到我這邊。我幫妳拉起來。
Pull the fish to my side and I will help you pull it up.

S.FORM: Tutuza macihal! Mastan'in haip pa sinlaskan, makmuzin na kalala'.
Totoza macihal! Mastan'in haip pa sinlaskan, makmozin na kalala'.
S.TRANSL: 太好了!今天大豐收，魚簍都裝滿了。
Great! It is a bumper crop today with full fish baskets.

S.FORM: Ina kava cata mucoqes paqosli cikopa tu tec'an.
Ina kava cata mocoqes paqosli cikopa to tec'an.
S.TRANSL: 我們快回去和大家分享。
Let’s go back immediately and share it with everyone.

S.FORM: ni'in tu muqnang kavivila, kavain mulungku ha`an ulungquan ta.
ni'in to moqnang kavivila, kavain molongko ha`an olongqoan ta.
S.TRANSL: 不要再玩了，快坐在座位上。
Stop playing and quickly sit in your seat.

S.FORM: malihima haip, pal'u'un laqming, muskuna munata kavila!
malihima haip, pal'o'on laqming, moskona monata kavila!
S.TRANSL: 今天星期五，明天放假，一起出去玩吧!
It’s Friday today, we have a day off tomorrow. Let’s go out and play together!
Great! Let’s go to the riverside.
What day will it be tomorrow?

S.FORM: malitiun laqbing, matlaqming minaun tungquvalika munnata ata kavila mali!
malition laqbing, matlaqming minaon tongqovalika monnata ata kavila mali!
S.TRANSL: 明天星期三，我們明天下午去玩球吧!
Tomorrow will be Wednesday. Let’s go play ball tomorrow afternoon!
What will you be doing tomorrow morning?

S.FORM: islungquan laqbing, muskun cak tina munha'an kiuka.
islongqoan laqbing, moskon cak tina monha'an kioka.
S.TRANSL: 明天是星期日，我要和媽媽去教會。
Tomorrow will be Sunday, I will be going to church with my mom.

S.FORM: asa cak mutaq, munhan cak unata'an.
asa cak motaq, monhan cak onata'an.
S.TRANSL: I feel like vomiting. I need to go to the restroom.

S.FORM: masnanava, macakbitat tian nak, asa munha'an unata'an.
masnanava, macakbitat tian nak, asa monha'an onata'an.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我肚子痛，要去廁所。
Teacher, I have a stomachache. I need to go to the restroom.
May I go wash my hands?
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.

S.FORM: masnanava, macakbitsala bung nak, maca tinunqovali ka na macingav tu mal'u.
masnanava, macakbitsala bong nak, maca tinonqovali ka na macingav to mal'o.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我頭好痛，下午要請假。
It’s almost time for class to end. Wait a little longer.
Okay, take care and go home.

S.FORM: masnanava, na macingav cak mal'u ki muqnin malic'an, namun ising cak.
masnanava, na macingav cak mal'o ki moqnin malic'an, namon ising cak.
S.TRANSL: 老師，我下禮拜一要請假，我要去看醫生。
Teacher, I need to take a sick leave next Monday. I have to see a doctor.

S.FORM: cakbit tian cia, han naip unata`an ta.
cakbit tian cia, han naip onata`an ta.
S.TRANSL: She has a stomachache. She’s in the restroom.

S.FORM: masnanava, cakbit cia Usung nga mudan, mal`u naip haip.
masnanava, cakbit cia Usong nga modan, mal`o naip haip.
S.TRANSL: Teacher, Usung has a sore throat. She took a sick leave today.

S.FORM: macak ka lizu, mac'anin nak qamisan.
macak ka lizo, mac'anin nak qamisan.
S.TRANSL: My name is lizu, and I’m 10 years old.
What ethnic group are you from?
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?
是的，我們全家都是布農族人。
Yes, my whole family is Bunun.
你的家人都是原住民嗎?
Are all your family members indigenous?

S.FORM: ni,manak tama ka bunun, maq qa tina ka put.
ni,manak tama ka bonon, maq qa tina ka pot.
S.TRANSL: 不是，我的爸爸是布農族，我的媽媽是漢人。
No, my father is Bunun, and my mother is Han Taiwanese.

S.FORM: tama su naipa? Pin qamisan cia?
tama so naipa? Pin qamisan cia?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: tama su naipa? pincia ka kamisan?
tama so naipa? pincia ka kamisan?
S.TRANSL: 那位是你爸爸嗎? 他幾歲了?
Is that your father? How old is he?

S.FORM: ni, manaipun na inam ha'an acangti madadaingaz. mavau`unin cia qamisan.
ni, manaipon na inam ha'an acangti madadaingaz. mavao`onin cia qamisan.
S.TRANSL: 不是，他是我們部落的耆老。他80歲了。
No, he is an elder of our tribe. He is 80 years old.

S.FORM: mastan na tuqas su madia a qamisan?
mastan na toqas so madia a qamisan?
S.TRANSL: 你哥哥年紀比你大很多嗎?
Is your brother much older than you?

S.FORM: haiza tu hima' qamisan na qais.
haiza to hima' qamisan na qais.
macak ka tas'asaba masipatun na tatnul.
macak ka tas'asaba masipaton na tatnol.
talmadin nit pasadu, dutaldaqvas sin asu?
talmadin nit pasado, dotaldaqvas sin aso?
S.TRANSL: 好久不見，你是不是長高了?
I haven’t seen you in a while. Have you grown taller?

S.FORM: u', haizin cak tu tas'asabah tu matiun tatdul.
o', haizin cak to tas'asabah to mation tatdol.
u, matiunin nak ka tingting laupadau.
o, mationin nak ka tingting laopadao.
munha'an cak dangan kuzkuza'an ta kilim masnanava.
monha'an cak dangan kozkoza'an ta kilim masnanava.
S.TRANSL: I’m going to the office to see the teacher.
He’s going to throw away the trash.

S.FORM: iha'an naip taldanavanta, manaip unicin na paintatav taldanav.
iha'an naip taldanavanta, manaip onicin na paintatav taldanav.
S.TRANSL: 他在游泳池，他等一下要比賽游泳。
He’s at the swimming pool. He’s going to compete in a swimming competition later.

S.FORM: icaq qa Langui? na paintataiv naip unicin tindangkul.
icaq qa Langoi? na paintataiv naip onicin tindangkol.
S.TRANSL: Langui在哪裡?她等一下要比賽跑步。
Where is Langui? She’s going to compete in a running competition later.

S.FORM: ha'an naip u'anpukan ta, una'uk naip.
ha'an naip o'anpokan ta, ona'ok naip.
S.TRANSL: She’s in the auditorium. I’ll go call her.
Let’s go to the playground together.

S.FORM: ngausang cak mudan mabaliv paitu tungqovali tu kaunun, na kilimuk asu unicin.
ngaosang cak modan mabaliv paito tongqovali to kaonon, na kilimok aso onicin.
S.TRANSL: 我先去買午餐，等一下去找你。
I’ll go buy lunch first, and then I’ll meet you later.
Let’s carry the lunch boxes together!

S.FORM: kilima asu duma bunun, na kilim cak masnanava.
kilima aso doma bonon, na kilim cak masnanava.
S.TRANSL: 你找別人，我要去找老師。
You find someone else, I’m going to find the teacher.

S.FORM: Ulang maqhaip pa paintataiv vi maludaq mali?
Ulang maqhaip pa paintataiv vi malodaq mali?
S.TRANSL: Is Ulang competing in croquet today?

S.FORM: ni, minhamu aipun ni Sandauncik tu pantataiv.
ni, minhamo aipon ni Sandaoncik to pantataiv.
S.TRANSL: No, he’s competing in high jump.

S.FORM: duna minhamu asu paintataiv vi unzukain?
dona minhamo aso paintataiv vi onzokain?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: u, minhamu cak ki tindakul tu sinpaintataiv.
o, minhamo cak ki tindakol to sinpaintataiv.
duna minhamu asu ki unzukai'in paintataiv?
dona minhamo aso ki onzokai'in paintataiv?
S.TRANSL: 運動會那天你會上場比賽嗎?
Will you compete in the sports day?

S.FORM: na minhamu cak ki maludaq mali tu sinpaintataiv.
na minhamo cak ki malodaq mali to sinpaintataiv.

S.TRANSL: 我們運動會那天要做甚麼?
What will we do in the sports day?
We will compete in tug of war.
我們運動會要賣食物嗎?
Will we sell food at the sports day?
你獲得了第一名耶，真是厲害！
Congratulations on getting first place! You’re amazing!
Yes, she’s sleeping in her room.

S.FORM: uka, laupang naip mudan munata, na sanavanin mulumaq
oka, laopang naip modan monata, na sanavanin molomaq
S.TRANSL: 不在，她剛出去了，要晚上才回家。
No, she’s not. She just went out and will be back in the evening.

S.FORM: ha'an naip dazata, mundaza'a asu kilin cia.
ha'an naip dazata, mondaza'a aso kilin cia.
S.TRANSL: 他在二樓，你上去找他吧。
He’s upstairs. You can go up and find him.

S.FORM: uu, lingkav, talmadin nitu pasadu su'u, macihal naupa asu?
oo, lingkav, talmadin nito pasado so'o, macihal naopa aso?
S.TRANSL: 是lingkav阿，很久沒有看到你了，你好嗎?
It’s lingkav. I haven’t seen you in a while! How have you been?
I’m doing great! I came to chat with you.

S.FORM: iha'an naip pit'a'ai'an makaling sanglav, tupauku naip.
iha'an naip pit'a'ai'an makaling sanglav, topaoko naip.
S.TRANSL: 他在廚房炒菜，我去叫他。
He’s in the kitchen cooking. Let me go call him.
She went to the chicken coop to catch chickens.

S.FORM: uka a qudasnanaz mu ilumaq, iha'an naip quma, hana amu lumaq maltala cia mucuqais.
oka a qodasnanaz mo ilomaq, iha'an naip qoma, hana amo lomaq maltala cia mocoqais.
S.TRANSL: 你們的爺爺不在家，他在田裡，你們在家等他回來吧。
Your grandfather is not at home. He’s in the field. Wait for him to come back.
I haven’t seen you in a while. You’ve grown taller.

S.FORM: sadu su'u minsuma tuzatu manaskal la isang.
sado so'o minsoma tozato manaskal la isang.
S.TRANSL: It’s so good to see you.
這是給你們的鳳梨，要放到冰箱裡。
Here’s a pineapple for you. Put it in the refrigerator.

S.FORM: talmadin nitumun`iti, luklacan zaku muskun mun`iti ma'un qaising.
talmadin nitomon`iti, loklacan zako moskon mon`iti ma'on qaising.
S.TRANSL: 這麼久沒來，我叫大家一起來吃飯。
It’s been a while. Let’s have a meal together.

S.FORM: nitupin kuzakuza, muaz cak qo ucia, iha'an ata buqzavan pababazbaz.
nitopin kozakoza, moaz cak qo ocia, iha'an ata boqzavan pababazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 不用麻煩了，我喝茶就好，我們來客廳聊天。
No need to bother. I’ll just have tea. Let’s sit in the living room and chat.

S.FORM: miqumicang ngi sinkadaidz su, na mudanin cak.
miqomicang ngi sinkadaidz so, na modanin cak.
S.TRANSL: 謝謝你的招待，我要回去了。
Thank you for your hospitality. I have to go now.

S.FORM: laupang nga tulkukdi sinpataz, dasi mulumaq dauqdauqkun ma'un.
laopang nga tolkokdi sinpataz, dasi molomaq daoqdaoqkon ma'on.
S.TRANSL: 這隻雞剛殺好，你帶回去慢慢吃。
This chicken was just freshly killed. Take it home and enjoy it slowly.

S.FORM: muskun cak su'u laqbing patumantu ki tidunquvalin maqtu?
moskon cak so'o laqbing patomanto ki tidonqovalin maqto?
S.TRANSL: 我和您約明天下午好嗎?
Can I make an appointment with you tomorrow afternoon?

S.FORM: maqtu, na icaq ata pataqu ki dangan pasadu?
maqto, na icaq ata pataqo ki dangan pasado?
maqtu ata pataqu tu na iha'an sisipulanta? siza`an ata qaningu.
maqto ata pataqo to na iha'an sisipolanta? siza`an ata qaningo.
S.TRANSL: 我們約學校好嗎?我們要錄影。
How about meeting at school? We need to shoot a video.

S.FORM: namunha'an u'anpupukanta, napainukan cak hulucbunun mun ita.
namonha'an o'anpopokanta, napainokan cak holocbonon mon ita.
S.TRANSL: 那去聚會所好了，我會穿族服去。
Then let’s go to the community center. I’ll wear folk costume.

S.FORM: manau'az nam a puaq banuaz ha`an acing. Maca nakapuaqin na kiliming cak!
manao'az nam a poaq banoaz ha`an acing. Maca nakapoaqin na kiliming cak!
S.TRANSL: 我們部落的梅花盛開很漂亮。等花開的時候你來找我吧!
The cherry blossoms in our tribe are beautiful when they bloom. Come find me when the flowers bloom!

S.FORM: na asat taunahanin minqamisan, na macuavin halacan!
na asat taonahanin minqamisan, na macoavin halacan!
S.TRANSL: 那要等到冬天，太晚了吧!
That would have to wait until spring. It’s too late, isn’t it?
那你打耳祭的時候來吧!
Then come during our Ear Festival!
Alright! I’m looking forward to it!

S.FORM: macingav su'u tu makuacuna mucuqas ha'an acing ti miqumic?
macingav so'o to makoacona mocoqas ha'an acing ti miqomic?
S.TRANSL: 請問你為甚麼要搬回部落生活?
May I ask why you decided to move back to the tribe?
I want to return to teach at the local school.

S.FORM: kuacuna nitu iha'an bukzav masnava i paitasan?
koacona nito iha'an bokzav masnava i paitasan?
S.TRANSL: Why not teach in the city?

S.FORM: maupa macalpu cak ki acang nak, asang macuqesang picihal li acang.
maopa macalpo cak ki acang nak, asang macoqesang picihal li acang.
S.TRANSL: 因為我懷念我的故鄉，也希望能回饋部落。
Because I miss my hometown and I also want to give back to the tribe.

S.FORM: maqanciap asu matinun, cimaq qa taqu su'u?
maqanciap aso matinon, cimaq qa taqo so'o?
S.TRANSL: 你很會織布，是誰教你的?
You’re very skilled at weaving, who taught you?

S.FORM: cia qudasnau'az nak, ciata a mastan maqanciap matinun ha'an acangti tu bunun.
cia qodasnao'az nak, ciata a mastan maqanciap matinon ha'an acangti to bonon.
S.TRANSL: 是我的奶奶，她是我們部落最會織布的人。
It was my grandmother, she is the most skilled weaver in our tribe.

S.FORM: qua casu tu milickin tu na asat painanam mi matiun?
qoa caso to milickin to na asat painanam mi mation?
S.TRANSL: How did you develop an interest in learning weaving?

S.FORM: maca matin'un dika imitatu sin'iqumican, na asauk naipi mangunu ki maikikingna.
maca matin'on dika imitato sin'iqomican, na asaok naipi mangono ki maikikingna.
S.TRANSL: 織布是我們的文化，我想要讓文化延續。
Weaving is a part of our culture, and I want to ensure its continuity.
你真厲害，這要釀很久嗎?
You’re really talented. Does it take a long time to make?

S.FORM: ni, maqtu tas'a islungqu'an. Ngausun puskun ni tilacpaz ma'aliv pit'ia, na uskununin tangtangtamul mahibulhibul piszang, namaqtuin uladingun ha'an qatumuaz.
ni, maqto tas'a islongqo'an. Ngaoson poskon ni tilacpaz ma'aliv pit'ia, na oskononin tangtangtamol mahibolhibol piszang, namaqtoin oladingon ha'an qatomoaz.
S.TRANSL: 不用，大約一周就好了。把糯米和白米先蒸熟，再加入麴粉一起拌勻，就可以裝到甕裡了。
No, it only takes about a week. After steaming the sticky rice and white rice, we mix it with yeast powder, and then it can be stored in a jar.

S.FORM: haiza nak ha'an di ka daput cin tilkum, amin anak sincuaz nak!
haiza nak ha'an di ka dapot cin tilkom, amin anak sincoaz nak!
S.TRANSL: 我這裡有辣椒和蕗蕎，都是我自己種的喔!
I have chili and lokiy, both grown by myself!

S.FORM: asauk ka huluc di, pi'iaq cui?
asaok ka holoc di, pi'iaq coi?
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡這件衣服，多少錢?
I like this piece of clothing. How much is it?
It’s too expensive. Can’t you lower the price a bit?

S.FORM: nitumaktu, muqna sitikicun na sung cak.
nitomakto, moqna sitikicon na song cak.
S.TRANSL: No, if I lower it further, I’ll lose money.

S.FORM: uu! nasiza azak mataqdung tu huluc.
oo! nasiza azak mataqdong to holoc.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!那我要一件黑色的衣服。
Alright then, I’ll take a black piece of clothing.
我要這把刀和這個鍋子。
I want this knife and this pot.

S.FORM: muskun dusasinging cui, ain'ana'kan nak matas'i, nanu tu maqtu talmadia ukma'aiun.
moskon dosasinging coi, ain'ana'kan nak matas'i, nano to maqto talmadia okma'aion.
S.TRANSL: 總共2000元，這是我自己手工打造的，保證可以用很久。
It’s a total of 2000 dollars. I handmade these, and they are guaranteed to last a long time.

S.FORM: nataqu`an zaku ka kavi'az nak tu munhanati mabaliv, maqtu iasui tu tikic?
nataqo`an zako ka kavi'az nak to monhanati mabaliv, maqto iasoi to tikic?
S.TRANSL: 我介紹朋友來買，可以再便宜一些嗎?
I’ll introduce my friend to buy. Can you give a further discount?
Alright! I’ll give you a 20% discount.

S.FORM: hanuin sadu! Haiza amin na huluc cin tamuhung isbabaliv.
hanoin sado! Haiza amin na holoc cin tamohong isbabaliv.
S.TRANSL: 來看看喔!衣服帽子都有賣。
Come and take a look! We sell clothes and hats.

S.FORM: tausaba tu mahima`un cui ka tas'a huluc, maca tau ka tas`asinging cui
taosaba to mahima`on coi ka tas'a holoc, maca tao ka tas`asinging coi
S.TRANSL: One piece of clothing is 350 dollars, three pieces for 1000 dollars.

S.FORM: muaz cak baliv tu tas'a, aivng cak ki baqlu.
moaz cak baliv to tas'a, aivng cak ki baqlo.
S.TRANSL: 我買一件就好，請給我新的。
I’ll just buy one piece, please give me a new one.

S.FORM: miqumicang, asacak mabaliv vi qesingdulaz cin pinizaipuq titi hibulan maqav.
miqomicang, asacak mabaliv vi qesingdolaz cin pinizaipoq titi hibolan maqav.
S.TRANSL: 你好，我想要買糯米飯和山胡椒滷肉。
Hello, I would like to buy sticky rice and braised pork with maqaw pepper.

S.FORM: aminunin na qaising isbaliv. Haizang nak tinpulatana, mabaliv asu?
aminonin na qaising isbaliv. Haizang nak tinpolatana, mabaliv aso?
S.TRANSL: 飯賣完了。我還有刺蔥油餅，你要買嗎?
The rice is sold out. I have tana pancakes, would you like to buy them?

S.FORM: u! aving cak tas'aun, maca muqnin na muqnang cak baliv qaising.
o! aving cak tas'aon, maca moqnin na moqnang cak baliv qaising.
S.TRANSL: 好吧!請給我一份，我下次再來買飯。
Alright, please give me one. I’ll come back next time to buy rice.

S.FORM: u, kangazak ku asu malading ha'an kapa, kaupata`a mahima`un cui.
o, kangazak ko aso malading ha'an kapa, kaopata`a mahima`on coi.
S.TRANSL: W：好，我幫你用袋子裝起來，這樣50元。
Okay, I’ll pack it in a bag for you. That’ll be 50 dollars.
